results.title: Health begins at home
results.creator_credit: Ivan Ivanov-Vano, WHO and Soluzmultfilm, Moscow
results.brief_description: Animated film on public health and health education. The spirit of sickness decides to concentrate on a house where a family lives happily and healthily. After much effort the “spirit” manages to install himself but with the help of the medical services the family finally evicts the evil “spirit” and returns to normal life. The spirit seeks other homes where he may inflict disease and misery but the health services are busy protecting the people.

results.title: Health and Fitness at Work-It Works
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Sport, Recreation and Tourism and Department Sports
results.brief_description: The physical fitness of a company’s employees can make an important contribution to the fiscal health of the whole organisation. It is now well recognised that healthy employees are more productive, are absent less frequently, and suffer fewer of the illnesses which plague modern life. Health and fitness programs at work are extremely successful in encouraging new health habits with important benefits for both employees and employers.

results.title: Healing and the mind. Eps. 4-6
results.creator_credit: Pamela Mason Wagner and David Griebin Productions
results.brief_description: Broadcast journalist Bill Moyers reports on new insights into mind-body connections, and on some of the people - scientists, physicians and patients - who are describing new ways to think about “sickness” and “health”. “The art of healing” introduces health care professionals who recognise that emotional states play an important role in people’s vulnerability to disease, and in their recovery. Most people view illness as a mechanical breakdown that afflicts the body and requires technical care, “Wounded healers” investigates what it really means to get well.

results.title: Healing and the mind. Eps. 1-3
results.creator_credit: Pamela Mason Wagner and David Griebin Productions
results.brief_description: Broadcasting journalist Bill Moyers reports on new insights into mind-body connections, and on some of the people - scientists, physicians and patients - which are describing new ways to think about “sickness” and ” health”. “The mystery of Chi” is filmed on location in Beijing and Shanghai, Moyers explores the role of the energy force known as chi in Chinese medicine and its implications for healing. “Mind-body connection” investigates medical scientists on the frontier of mind-body research. “Healing from within” examines Eastern meditation and Western group psychotherapy - methods which can teach people to use their minds to improve the healing capacity of their bodies.

results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Judith Odgers
results.brief_description: Judith is teaching in Thailand as a young teacher. It is an extraordinary cultural experience and also life changing as Judith is diagnosed with HIV. This story delves into the psyche of a young woman coming to terms with the taboos and limitations of the virus she has contracted.

results.title: Healing
results.creator_credit: Pierre Lasry, Michael McKennirey, Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Balancing moments of strong emotional impact with cool-headed logic, this documentary explores the phenomenon of faith healing. Scenes of Kathryn Kuhlman’s dramatic performance before 25 000 people at the Ottawa Civic Centre are balanced by interviews with articulate doctors and scientists who argue both sides of the “healing” issue. (Award: Columbus.)
